author: slive
msg: Get the main page closer to something I can live with.
Some changes:
1. New first paragraph which is more upbeat and more focused on apache
in general rather than the specifics of the ASF.  The paragraph that
was there will be moved to the foundation/index.html page.
2. Comment out the software map and replace it with some "Featured
Projects".  I imagine these will rotate frequently to focus on major
releases and other interesting happenings in the apache world.  The
map is a neat idea, but I can't see how to make it anywhere near
comprehensive and understandable.  Perhaps it belongs on the
projects.html page.
3. Change the search box to search all apache.org (not just
www.apache.org).  Again, the main page should not belong to the ASF,
but to apache in general.

author: slive
msg: Convert/move files.

author: slive
msg: announce@apache.org never has been a foundation mailing list.  It has always
been HTTP-server specific.
If we want a foundation list (for what?) we should move this one to
announce@httpd.apache.org, but the existing subscribers signed up for
HTTP Server stuff, not foundation stuff.

author: slive
msg: How did that get in there?

author: slive
msg: Mark my place.
